name: Kepler-539
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-539 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-539 is a star with 1.05 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.95 times its radius. It is located 1011.12 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-539 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-539 system


Kepler-539 b

Kepler-539 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.50 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-539 b is 308.46 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-539 b is 8.373 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-539 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


Kepler-539 c

Kepler-539 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit timing variations method. Its semi-major axis is 2.42 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-539 c is 763.1999999999999 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-539 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-539, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
